Market crash wipes out Rs 13 lakh crore. Will D-Street's losing streak continue? Stock Market Crash: Dalal Street faced another sharp decline on Monday, with key indices tumbling and investors suffering heavy losses. Is this a temporary dip, or the start of a prolonged bear run?

Sensex nosedives over 1,100 points. HCLTech to announce Q3 results today: What to expect from the IT giant HCLTech Q3 results preview: Market analysts predict that HCLTech will show robust growth in the December quarter, driven by its software business and recent acquisition of the Communications Technology Group (CTG).

Adani Wilmar share price falls 8% to hit 52-week low. Here's why Adani Wilmar stock price: Market cap of Adani Wilmar stood at Rs 35,494.22 crore. The stock has fallen 15.88% in the past week, 18.31% in the last 6 months, and 24.94% in the past year.

Rupee hits all-time low of 86/USD. Will it decline further?The rupee slipped 0.4% to a record low of 86.39 per dollar. Check the key factors behind this decline and whether the Indian currency faces further challenges.

Explained: Why Biocon share price climbed over 4% in early trade todayBiocon's share price climbed to an intraday high of Rs 377.50 per share in intraday trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). As of 10:23 am, Biocon's stock was trading at Rs 376.60 per share, up 4.34% on the BSE.

Budget 2025: Experts push for HRA inclusion, Rs 1 lakh standard deduction Amid rising costs and squeezed disposable incomes, the spotlight is on the new tax regime, with experts pushing the demands for HRA inclusion and a Rs 1 lakh standard deduction in Budget 2025.

Rupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollar, likely to remain volatileRupee hits all-time low: For the Indian economy, the sustained pressure on the rupee could translate to higher import costs and a potential rise in inflation.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

Why Omar Abdullah's praise for PM Modi while lugging Congress is noteworthyJammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah heaped praise on Prime Minister Narendra Modi for working to bridge the distance between Delhi and Srinagar, and of hearts. He also lauded Modi for the free and fair elections in J&K. The praise comes at a time the National Conference leader has been critical of ally Congress.

BJP using court as tool to play political games: AAP flags party's CAG remarksAAP accused the BJP of misusing Delhi High Court observations in a press conference, alleging an attempt to politicise the judiciary, soon after the court criticised AAP's delay in tabling CAG reports.

Why Isro aborted the SpaDeX docking after bringing satellites closeISRO Spadex: The latest attempt, which began just after midnight, saw Isro successfully narrow the distance between two satellites from 230 meters to 15 meters using the slow drift technique.

Have 4 children, get Rs 1 lakh: Madhya Pradesh Brahmin board chief to couplesPandit Vishnu Rajoria, the president of Parshuram Kalyan Board, said it was important for Brahmin couples to produce four children to "protect Sanatana Dharma". He said he would reward such couples having four children.

Amid H-1B visa turmoil, some Indians lose job offers, others dreamsIndians are caught in the H-1B visa crossfire amid debate over employment policy as US President-elect Donald Trump prepares to take office on January 20. There are reports of Indians being hit as US employers withdraw job offers, and students planning to study in American colleges fear being caught in the anti-immigrant whirlwind.

Parents visit IIT-Kharagpur to meet son, find him hanging in his roomA third-year Electrical Engineering student of IIT-Kharagpur was found dead inside his hostel room by his parents who had come to meet him. Police have launched a probe into the incident.

Mark Zuckerberg wants more masculine energy, less diversity in corporate cultureMeta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, in a bold interview with Joe Rogan, advocated for embracing "masculine energy" in corporate culture while scaling back diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives. Meta recently also eased content moderation policies and fact-checking.

Nishesh took the opening set before going down fighting in Melbourne on Monday, January 13.

How Yogi Adityanath is charting own course on Hindutva heritageThere are two streams of thought in the larger Hindutva family when it comes to the disputed places of worship. With his stance that "reclaiming heritage is not a bad thing", Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has charted a distinct course, different from RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's.

NDA government completes what it starts: PM after inaugurating Z-Morh TunnelSpeaking after the inauguration of Z-Morh Tunnel, PM Modi said that the tunnel will ensure Sonamarg's connectivity during winter, giving "new wings" to tourism in Jammu and Kashmir.

Maha Kumbh 2025: When to visit, where to stayThe 45-day Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 in Prayagraj, a once-in-144-year spiritual gathering, commenced on January 13. The congregation is expected to draw 450 million devotees to the Triveni Sangam. Visitors can choose to visit on the six auspicious bathing days or opt for less-crowded dates. Here are the various accommodation options, ranging from tent cities and luxury hotels to budget lodges.

From boosting defence logistics to tourism, here's why Z-Morh Tunnel is importantZ-Morh Tunnel: The project, completed at a cost of over Rs 2,700 crore, also features a parallel 7.5-meter-wide parallel escape tunnel for enhanced safety. It significantly reduces travel time between Srinagar and Sonamarg.

India not doing well in Test cricket: New BCCI secretary vows to make changesNewly appointed BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia has vowed to help India return to their best shape in Test cricket. Saikia has acknowledged that India have dropped the ball in Tests in the recent times.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
